Synthetic Optimization Analysis SYNTHETIC

Based on synthetic changeover time modeling, the analysis identifies 234 optimizable transitions (>30 min) that could save an estimated SAR 185,000/year through improved scheduling. These projections require actual changeover tracking data for validation.

Savings Calculation Methodology

The synthetic savings estimate uses illustrative values to demonstrate what real analysis could reveal:

1.
Per-Transition Savings (SAR 150-250)

Assumed ~30 min average changeover reduction × SAR 300-500/hour operational cost ÷ 2

2.
Annual Total (SAR 185,000)

234 optimizable transitions × ~790 SAR average annual savings each

Real Calculation Formula:

Annual Savings = Σ (Transitions) × (Time Reduced hrs) × (Hourly Cost) × (Annual Frequency)

Data Required for Real Calculations:

  • Actual changeover timestamps (start/end per SPSA transition)
  • Transition frequency data (occurrences per year)
  • Labor + machine downtime costs per hour
  • Baseline vs optimized changeover measurements

Throughput Optimization Recommendations

Available with Current Data

  • • Analyze accelerator workload distribution for balancing
  • • Identify peak and off-peak processing patterns
  • • Review customer scheduling for batch optimization
  • • Compare speed settings across product types

Data Collection Suggestions

  • • Changeover timestamps - to measure actual transition times
  • • Idle time logs - to identify unplanned downtime
  • • Production schedule - to compare planned vs actual
  • • Maintenance windows - to optimize scheduling
